contentrichtext.text: '''David F. Weinstein''' is a former [[United States Democratic Party|Democratic]] member of the [[North Carolina General Assembly]] who represented the state's thirteenth [[North Carolina Senate|Senate]] district, including constituents in [[Hoke County, North Carolina|Hoke]] and [[Robeson County, North Carolina|Robeson]] counties. A retired merchant from [[Lumberton, North Carolina]], Weinstein served in the Senate from 1997 through 2009, when Gov. [[Beverly Perdue]] appointed him to head the Governorâ€™s Highway Safety Program. He was replaced in the Senate by [[Michael P. Walters]]. ==References== *[http://robesonian.com/pages/full_story/push?article-Walters+sworn+in-+gets+to+work%20&id=4534847&instance=secondary_news_left_column The Robesonian: Walters sworn in, gets to work] {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Weinstein, David F. | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American politician | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Weinstein, David F.}} [[Category:North Carolina State Senators]] [[Category:North Carolina Democrats]] [[Category:Jewish American politicians]] [[Category:Living people]] {{NorthCarolina-politician-stub}}
